body_text: Is this something the linter did? We usually go with an eslint rule like quotes: [warn, single, {avoidEscape: true}], which allows us to use double quotes if it prevents escaping here. I don't see that in our .eslintrc, but I think that we inherit from airbnb for it.
body: Is this something the linter did? We usually go with an eslint rule like `quotes: [warn, single, {avoidEscape: true}]`, which allows us to use double quotes if it prevents escaping here. I don't see that in our .eslintrc, but I think that we inherit from airbnb for it.
